<Tabs>
<TabItem label="JSON (and super languages)" icon="seti:json">
## Summary
- Rule available since: `v1.9.0`
- Diagnostic Category: [`assist/source/useSortedKeys`](/reference/diagnostics#diagnostic-category)
- The default severity of this rule is [**information**](/reference/diagnostics#information).
## How to enable in your editor
<EditorAction action="source.action.useSortedKeys.biome" />
## Description
Sorts the keys of a JSON object in natural order

## Examples

```json
{
    "vase": "fancy",
    "nested": {
        "omega": "bar",
        "alpha": "foo"
    }
}
```

## How to configure
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"assist": {
		"actions": {
			"source": {
				"useSortedKeys": "on"
			}
		}
	}
}

```

</TabItem>
<TabItem label="JavaScript (and super languages)" icon="seti:javascript">
## Summary
:::note
This rule is currently only available in the [2.0 beta release](/blog/biome-v2-0-beta).
:::
- Diagnostic Category: [`assist/source/useSortedKeys`](/reference/diagnostics#diagnostic-category)
- The default severity of this rule is [**information**](/reference/diagnostics#information).
## How to enable in your editor
<EditorAction action="source.action.useSortedKeys.biome" />
## Description
Enforce ordering of a JS object properties.

This rule checks if keys of the object are sorted in a consistent way.
Keys are sorted in a [natural sort order](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natural_sort_order).
This rule will consider spread/calculated keys e.g [k]: 1 as non-sortable.
Instead, whenever it encounters a non-sortable key, it will sort all the
previous sortable keys up until the nearest non-sortable key, if one
exist.
This prevents breaking the override of certain keys using spread
keys.

Source: https://perfectionist.dev/rules/sort-objects

## Examples

```js
{
  x: 1,
  a: 2,
};
```

<pre class="language-diff"><code class="language-diff">code-block.js:3:4 parse ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">✖</span></strong> <span style="color: Tomato;">Expected a semicolon or an implicit semicolon after a statement, but found none</span><br />  <br />    <strong>1 │ </strong>&#123;<br />    <strong>2 │ </strong>  x: 1,<br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>3 │ </strong>  a: 2,<br />   <strong>   │ </strong>   <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>4 │ </strong>&#125;;<br />    <strong>5 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">An explicit or implicit semicolon is expected here...</span><br />  <br />    <strong>1 │ </strong>&#123;<br />    <strong>2 │ </strong>  x: 1,<br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>3 │ </strong>  a: 2,<br />   <strong>   │ </strong>   <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>4 │ </strong>&#125;;<br />    <strong>5 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">...Which is required to end this statement</span><br />  <br />    <strong>1 │ </strong>&#123;<br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>2 │ </strong>  x: 1,<br />   <strong>   │ </strong>     <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>3 │ </strong>  a: 2,<br />   <strong>   │ </strong>  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>4 │ </strong>&#125;;<br />    <strong>5 │ </strong><br />  <br /></code></pre>

```js
{
  x: 1,
  ...f,
  y: 4,
  a: 2,
  [calculated()]: true,
  b: 3,
  a: 1,
};
```

<pre class="language-diff"><code class="language-diff">code-block.js:3:3 parse ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">✖</span></strong> <span style="color: Tomato;">Expected an expression but instead found '...'.</span><br />  <br />    <strong>1 │ </strong>&#123;<br />    <strong>2 │ </strong>  x: 1,<br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>3 │ </strong>  ...f,<br />   <strong>   │ </strong>  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>4 │ </strong>  y: 4,<br />    <strong>5 │ </strong>  a: 2,<br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Expected an expression here.</span><br />  <br />    <strong>1 │ </strong>&#123;<br />    <strong>2 │ </strong>  x: 1,<br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>3 │ </strong>  ...f,<br />   <strong>   │ </strong>  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>4 │ </strong>  y: 4,<br />    <strong>5 │ </strong>  a: 2,<br />  <br /></code></pre>

```js
{
  get aab() {
    return this._aab;
  },
  set aac(v) {
    this._aac = v;
  },
  w: 1,
  x: 1,
  ...g,
  get aaa() {
    return "";
  },
  u: 1,
  v: 1,
  [getProp()]: 2,
  o: 1,
  p: 1,
  q: 1,
}
```

## How to configure
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"assist": {
		"actions": {
			"source": {
				"useSortedKeys": "on"
			}
		}
	}
}

```

</TabItem>
</Tabs>
